result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus Solis Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Any bond posted are to be applied against the fine and costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

timeConds.notes:
*Jail credit to be applied towards the 180 days
*Huber granted for employment and any counseling defendant may be involved in, and for educational purposes
*First 30 days to be in jail, last 150 days can be on GPS electronic monitoring

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Solis Jr.

records.addlTxt: Final Reminder Notice with request to pay in full or set up payment plan has been sent to the Defendant's address in the file as of this date. Failure to pay or set up payment plan--warrant may be issued.
Copy of Court Ordered Financial Obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing mailed to Jesus Solis @ 2500 Locust Drive Apt #1, Plover, WI  54467 - Return by Post Office as return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward
02/19/16 and one had been prepared on 01/08/14 and filed with Br 3 on01/14/14 - original filed in 12CF318

Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Jesus Solis in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 12CF-318 and 14CF-207.

2:16 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

This is set for a sentencing hearing today.
Defendant has been previously convicted.

There was a PSI prepared back in January 2014. 
A supplemental PSI was prepared, copies of both reports were forwarded to counsel.

Both parties are ready to proceed.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, recommendations are similar to the recommendations in the PSI.
Atty Arendt addreses the Court prior to sentencing, recommends probation and jail time. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

12CF-318:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of  4 years
Initial Confinement of 2 years
Extended Supervision of 2 years
350 Days Credit in the event probation is revoked
Impose and Stayed
Probation for a period fo 3 years
Conditions:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations from the agent
Comply with any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent
Pay a fine of $1,000 plus costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Submit a DNA Sample and Pay DNA Surcharge

14CF-207:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for a period of 4 years
Initial Confinement of 2 years
Extended Supervision of 2 years
Consecutive to 12CF-318
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 Years concurrent to 12CF-318
Conditions:
Comply with all conditions as stated in 12CF-318
Pay costs
Serve 180 Days Jail
1 Day Credit, to be applied against the 180 days jail
Huber granted for employment and any counseling Defendant may be involved in, and for educational purposes
First 30 days be in jail, last 150 days can be on GPS electronic monitoring

Appeal rights are addressed. Any bonds posted are to be applied against the fine and costs.

8:36 a.m. Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Jesus Solis in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states the status of the case on the record. Cases 12CF318 and 14CF207 are heard today for sentencing.  Court had requested an updated PSI report, but was not completed.  Sean Morrow, Supervisor, is present from the probation office.  Atty Arendt informs the court that his client wants to complete the updated PSI report.  ADA Knaapen states objections as the defendant had absconded when he should have completed the PSI. 
BTC: Reschedules to allow time for the updated PSI to be completed.  Updated PSI report to be submitted by 02-16-16 and given to the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Hearing mailed to Jesus Solis Jr @ 2500 Locust Drive, Apt 1, Plover, WI  54467 but has been returned by the post office as not deliverable as addressed, return to sender, unable to forward

Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Defendant Jesus Solis in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:07 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Count 1 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court notes there is a PSI in other files that the defendant has.  
Atty Arendt makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Knaapen. 
Court will not order a new PSI. 
Atty Arendt makes statements to the Court.  The PSI did not include an interview by the agent with his client.  Asks that the interview might be helpful.  Has discussed with DOC.  They would be willing to do that and update the report so that's in a more complete form.   
State has no position on that matter. 

BY THE COURT:  Court orders there be an updated PSI.   Updated PSI is to be completed by 1/7/2016.   Bonds previously ordered are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Jesus Solis in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:08 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt in court. Defendant Jesus Solis appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 12CF318, 14CF207

14CF207: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Knaapen addresses bond. 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

2:07 p.m. Defendant Jesus Solis appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin. 12CF318 is following.

14CF207:   Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation - asap. 
Bond continued.


  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jesus Solis appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 12CF318, 14CF207

Court reviews the file. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court. 

State recommends to revoke the bond in 12CF318 and have the matter set for a sentencing hearing or status conference.  Defendant was represented by Atty Pat Arendt but he has since withdrawn.  May need new counsel appointed. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond in 12CF318 is revoked.  
Defendant questions the Court.
Atty Cousins asks for a status conference.  He will notify the public defender that new counsel will need to be appointed and have someone present at the status conference. 

14CF207: 
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

This matter is continued for a status conference on 5/18/15 at 8:30. 

BY THE COURT:  14CF207:  $1,000 signature bond with no conditions.  Warrants in both files are revoked.
Defendant questions the Court.
